data.title: Durham School Services
data.meta_description:
Durham School Services | 8,909 followers on LinkedIn. Getting students to school safely, on time and ready to learn®. | Durham School Services is a full-service student transportation provider, committed to getting students to school safely, on time and ready to learn. We provide customer focused transportation services including home-to-school, special needs, and field trip transportation, as well as charter trips for districts, organizations and consumers across the United States.

Durham can trace its history back to a three-bus company started in 1917 in the San Gabriel Valley of California, providing student transportation service to the Rosemead School District, a community we still serve today.
data.text:
It was the first day of school at Smithville RII School District yesterday and we are proud of our team for making it a successful one! Thank you, Smithville School District, for your new partnership and support, and thank you to our team for their commitment and dedicated efforts in getting our students to school safely. Teamwork makes the dream work!

Our team members are constantly raising the bar for themselves and their fellow peers when it comes to providing exceptional service and demonstrating their dedication to their students and community. Recently, West Ada, ID, team members Thomas Geren, Special Education Driver and Evaluator, and Terry Marinos, Safety and Training Supervisor, were both recognized by the Idaho Department of Education for their unparalleled devotion to providing exemplary service to their students and community. Thomas was named the Special Needs Transportation Award winner, and Terry was named School Bus Driver Trainer of the Year. Congrats to them both! “Both Thomas and Terry are exceptional team members who holistically embody Durham’s and the school district’s core values. This is evidenced by their recognition from their peers and the Department of Education. Both awards are extremely well-deserved, and we are proud and grateful to be able to call them our own.” -- Sam Ray, General Manager, Durham School Services https://ow.ly/321J50T1bkG
